In October 2025 I applied for what appeared to be a remote job opportunity on a site that presented itself as a legitimate recruiting page. The scammers operated at least two fraudulent domains related to this scheme:1. https://www.netaporterjob.com/ — hosted on Wix.com (IP 34.149.87.45).2. https://www.naporter.shop/#/ — hosted via Cloudflare, Inc. (IP 172.67.138.48, United States).After registering on the fraudulent site(s) I was contacted by individuals using WhatsApp and Telegram. They persuaded me to transfer funds in cryptocurrency as part of the “onboarding/payment” / deposit process described by the scammers.Financial transfers and losses (breakdown):BityBank — USD 14,751.79Crypto — USD 24.401,13Mercado Bitcoin — USD 5,403.33Funds initially deposited into the wallets above were later routed to accounts on exchanges (which I have identified during my own investigation). The primary receiving exchanges/accounts where funds ended up are: BityBank, Crypto, and Mercado Bitcoin (values listed above). I have found associated accounts on LBank that received funds originating from Destination address: 1) Trou4EavgzEMoBp3V93LNaaiKY3Y3Rg5Cx2) TeqiXhjxBXenG3wvA2YiyDwJTuw6jeioerOther relevant details / indicators:My initial support request to LBank was registered under ticket number W4VFPN, but since I am not a direct customer of LBank, I was informed that no assistance could be provided. However. I am now seeking your collaboration with law enforcement for the formal investigation that has been opened in Brazil (Police Report No. PP8152-1/2025).The fraudulent webpages are impersonating a legitimate recruiting/job listing appearance and were hosted on platforms/services with infrastructure in the United States.Scammers used messaging apps (WhatsApp and Telegram) to guide me through conversion of my funds into crypto and to provide transaction instructions.I possess screenshots of the web pages, chat histories, wallet addresses, and transaction confirmations. I also have the on-chain links above confirming movement of tokens from the deposit addresses to the destination wallets/exchanges.

In October 2025 I applied for what appeared to be a remote job opportunity on a site that presented itself as a legitimate recruiting page. The scammers operated at least two fraudulent domains related to this scheme:

1. https://www.netaporterjob.com/ — hosted on Wix.com (IP 34.149.87.45).

2. https://www.naporter.shop/#/ — hosted via Cloudflare, Inc. (IP 172.67.138.48, United States).

After registering on the fraudulent site(s) I was contacted by individuals using WhatsApp and Telegram. They persuaded me to transfer funds in cryptocurrency as part of the “onboarding/payment” / deposit process described by the scammers.Financial transfers and losses (breakdown):

BityBank — USD 14,751.79

Crypto — USD 24.401,13

Mercado Bitcoin — USD 5,403.33

Funds initially deposited into the wallets above were later routed to accounts on exchanges (which I have identified during my own investigation). The primary receiving exchanges/accounts where funds ended up are: BityBank, Crypto, and Mercado Bitcoin (values listed above). I have found associated accounts on LBank that received funds originating from Destination address:

1) Trou4EavgzEMoBp3V93LNaaiKY3Y3Rg5Cx

2) TeqiXhjxBXenG3wvA2YiyDwJTuw6jeioer

Other relevant details / indicators:My initial support request to LBank was registered under ticket number W4VFPN, but since I am not a direct customer of LBank, I was informed that no assistance could be provided. However.

I am now seeking your collaboration with law enforcement for the formal investigation that has been opened in Brazil (Police Report No. PP8152-1/2025).

The fraudulent webpages are impersonating a legitimate recruiting/job listing appearance and were hosted on platforms/services with infrastructure in the United States.

Scammers used messaging apps (WhatsApp and Telegram) to guide me through conversion of my funds into crypto and to provide transaction instructions.

I possess screenshots of the web pages, chat histories, wallet addresses, and transaction confirmations. I also have the on-chain links above confirming movement of tokens from the deposit addresses to the destination wallets/exchanges.

Amount lost

44556.25 USD

The following sites have been reported by users as potentially fraudulent. These links are provided for reference and investigative purposes only, not as endorsements.

https://www.netaporterjob.com
